related_post.text: > @Kronos But if you change the instruction `a = [None]  5` to `a = [None]  7`@_rogue_shadow so i didn\'t know and i went digging. extended slices (3 argument slices) arent as flexible as 2 arg ones they need the list being assigned to be the same size as the slice. take a look here for more. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47968232/whyisextendedsliceassignmentlessflexiblethanregularsliceassignment

so_post.text: > @Kronos But if you change the instruction `a = [None]  5` to `a = [None]  7`@_rogue_shadow so i didn\'t know and i went digging. extended slices (3 argument slices) arent as flexible as 2 arg ones they need the list being assigned to be the same size as the slice. take a look here for more. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47968232/whyisextendedsliceassignmentlessflexiblethanregularsliceassignment
